title: Section 401 ITEPA 2003 and Part 3 Chapter 6 ITEPA 2003

details.body:
### Section 401 and Part 3 Chapter 6 ITEPA 2003 (car benefits) Benefits given during employment can continue after it. This example shows how to calculate the taxable amounts for the year of assessment in which the termination occurs where Part 3 Chapter 6 ITEPA 2003 (car benefits) is involved. There is another example at [EIM13905](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13905) where Part 3 Chapter 10 ITEPA 2003 is involved. An employer agrees to continue the provision of private use of a car for 2 years following termination of employment on 5 July 2003. A cash termination payment of £25,000 is also agreed. [EIM24000](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM24000) onwards explains the calculation of the benefit for 2002/03 under the benefits code. The price of the car is £22,500 (calculated as in [EIM24010](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM24000#EIM24010)). The cash equivalent of the benefit for 2003/04 under Part 3 Chapter 6 ITEPA 2003 up to the date of termination is as follows, see [EIM23700](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM23000#EIM23700):
Appropriate percentage of price of the car (CO2 emissions 155g/km, EIM24700) £22,500 x 15% £3,375
Time apportionment (see [EIM23700](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM23000#EIM23700) and [EIM25100](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM24000#EIM25100)) £3,375 x 275/366 £2,536
£839
The Section 401 ITEPA 2003 charge for the period after termination uses the same cash equivalent rules (see [EIM13270](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13270)) and so is identical except for the time-apportionment element. The calculation is then: So the amount chargeable for 2003/04 is £832 plus nil = £832.

The appropriate percentage arrived at from this table is subject to other adjustments for alternative fuels, though it is used unless the car falls within one of the categories for which adjustments are required. ## Sections 114(1) and Part 6 Chapter 3 ITEPA 2003

Occasionally an employer may allow an ex-employee to continue to use the provided car for some time after the employment has ceased but without transferring the car to the ownership of the employee.  In a case of continued use of a car, the amount of the car benefit charge is reduced on a time basis to the date of cessation at step 7 of Section 121(1) ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM25100](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM24000#EIM25100) onwards).

Any fuel scale charge is also reduced on a time basis.

For the tax treatment of the continuing availability of the car after employment has ceased, see [EIM12805](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM12805) onwards.

sections.body:
Section 403(1) ITEPA 2003 states that a payment or benefit
within Section 401(1) ITEPA 2003 (see
[EIM13000](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13000)) counts as employment income
(see
[EIM00510](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00510)) only to the extent that it
exceeds £30,000. The £30,000 figure is described as a
threshold.

Some payments and benefits must be added together before
applying the threshold, producing an aggregate.
[EIM13530](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13530) explains when this must be
done.
